openjson.title: OPENJSON (T‑SQL)
openjson.shortDescription: Traverse and project JSON into rows/columns with explicit mapping (WITH).

content.overview: OPENJSON is a table-valued function that reads a JSON document (or a specific path) and returns a table of (key, value, type). With the WITH clause, you can project typed columns mapped to JSON paths.

case1.title: Typed projection with WITH
case1.description: Extract scalar fields from JSON without manual parsing.

case2.title: Iterate over a JSON array (CROSS APPLY)
case2.description: Read each array element and project its properties.

case3.title: Per-row parsing with OUTER APPLY
case3.description: Apply OPENJSON to a JSON column per record while preserving NULL rows.

summary.title: Summary
summary.text: Use OPENJSON to turn JSON into SQL rows/columns, with WITH for a typed schema. Combine with CROSS/OUTER APPLY for per-row parsing.
cons: Careful with paths and NULL values

goodPractices.title: Best practices
items: Validate JSON structure in the app when possible
Limit the size of stored JSON documents
Index correlated columns when joining the result
